p.s: On the one hand many people would sa that there is a need of change.
There cannot always be the same plays everyone already knows.
Space is needed for development and new ideas!
On the other hand it is difficult to find such new idas.
Many many plays are inspired by Shakespeare, so it is difficult to just forget his work.
But to be fair, it cannot be that good for creativity to be reducted like that.
There should be a way to do what you want to do what you want without having to think of consequences of what others would say or think about this or that.
However, it cannot be that easy to let go of Shakespeare because a lot of people look up to him.
Shakespeare shaped the world's litaritureliterature, so he must be still relevant.
Another question is if younger people, especially children should really have to be tormented with that old boring language or if it's maybe time for modernization.
Otherwise one can say that our children deserve to get to know Shakespeare just like we did.
There probably is nobody, who can make this decision alone if Shakespeare's work is still relevant or not.
Maybe one day there can be found a way with who everybody is okay with.
Both sides are understandable, but there just should be no jump to conclusions.
